question: Harry! Are you alright?
answer: Hermione. Bad dream. When did you get here?

question: Just now. You?
answer: Last night.

question: Igor.
answer: Professor Dumbledore, my horses have travelled a long way. They will need attending to.

question: Not to worry Madame Maxime, our gamekeeper Hagrid's more than capable of seeing to them.
answer: But you know Monsieur Hagrid, they drink only single malt whiskey.

question: Alastor Moody. Ministry malcontent. And your new defence against the dark arts teacher. I'm here because Dumbledore asked me, end of story, goodbye, the end. Any questions? When it comes to the dark arts, I believe in a practical approach. But first, which of you can tell me how many unforgivable curses there are?
answer: Three sir.

question: And they are so named?
answer: Because they are unforgivable. Use of any one of them will...

question: Will earn you a one way ticket to Azkaban. Correct. Now the ministry says you're too young to see what these curses do. I say different! You need to know what you're up against, you need to be prepared, you need to find somewhere else to put your chewing gum other than the underside of your desk Mr Finnigan! So, which curse shall we see first? WEASLEY!
answer: Yes...

question: Give us a curse.
answer: Well, my dad did tell me about one... The imperious curse.

question: Cooked it up just this morning.
answer: It's not going to work.

question: Oh yeah? And why's that Granger.
answer: You see this? This is an age line. Dumbledore drew it himself.

question: So?
answer: So a genius like Dumbledore couldn't possibly be fooled by something pathetically dimwitted such as an age potion.

question: Harry! Did you put your name in the goblet of fire?
answer: No sir.

question: Did you ask one of the older students to do it for you?
answer: No sir.

question: You're absolutely sure?
answer: Yes sir.

question: This can't go on Albus. First the dark mark, now this?
answer: What do you suggest Minerva?

question: Put an end to it. Don't let Potter compete.
answer: You heard Barty the rules are clear.

question: How did you do it? Never mind. Doesn't matter. You could have let your best friend know though.
answer: Let you know what?

question: You know bloody well what.
answer: I didn't ask for this to happen Ron. Okay? You're being stupid.

question: Yeah that's me, Ron Weasley... Harry Potter's stupid friend.
answer: I didn't put my name in that cup. I don't WANT eternal glory I just wanna be.. Look, I don't know what happened tonight and I don't know why, it just did ok.

question: What a charismatic quartet. Hello! I'm Rita Skeeter, I write for the daily prophet. But of course you know that don't you. It's you we don't know, you're the news. What quirks lurk beneath those rosy cheeks? what mysteries do the muscles mask? does courage lie beneath those curls? In short, what makes a champion tick. Me, myself and I want to know. Not to mention my rabid readers. So, who's feeling up to sharing? Mmm? Shall we start with the youngest. Lovely. This is cosy.
answer: It's a broomcupboard.

question: You should feel right at home then. Don't mind if I use the quill do you?
answer: Oh, no.

question: So Harry, here you sit, a mere boy of twelve..
answer: I'm fourteen.

question: ...about to compete against three students. Not only vastly more emotionally mature than yourself but have mastered spells that you wouldn't attempt in your dizziest daydreams. Concerned?
answer: I dunno I haven't really thought about it.

question: Course you're not just any ordinary boy of twelve are you...
answer: Fourteen.

question: The story's legend. Do you think it was the trauma of your past that made you so keen to enter such a dangerous tournament.
answer: No I didn't enter.

question: Course you didn't. Everyone loves a rebel Harry. Scratch that last. Speaking of your parents, were they alive, how do you think they'd feel? proud? or concerned that your attitude shows at best a pathological need for attention, at worst a psychotic deathwish.
answer: Hey, my eyes aren't glistening with the ghosts of my past.

question: Hey, my eyes aren't glistening with the ghosts of my past.
answer: Harry. I couldn't risk sending Edward. It was since the world cup and the ministry's been intercepting more and more owls and she's too easily recognised. We need to talk Harry. Face to face. Meet me in the Griffindore common room at one o clock this Saturday night and make sure you're alone. P.S....

question: AGH!
answer: The bird bites.

question: Sirius?! How...
answer: I don't have much time Harry so let me get straight to it. Did you or did you not put your name into the goblet of fire?

question: No!
answer: Shh... I had to ask. Now, tell me about this dream of yours. You mentioned Wormtail and Voldemort, but who was the third man in the room?

question: I dunno.
answer: You didn't hear a name?

question: No. Umm.. Voldemort was giving him a job to do. Something important.
answer: What was that?

question: He wanted... me. I dunno why, but he was gonna use this man to get to me. I mean it was only a dream right?
answer: Yes. It's just a dream. Look Harry, the deatheaters at the world cup, your name rising from that goblet these are not just coincidences. Hogwarts isn't safe any more.

question: What are you saying?
answer: I'm saying the devils are inside the walls. Igor Karkaroff, he was a deatheater. And no one, no one stops being a deatheater. Then there's Barty Crouch, heart of stone, sent his OWN son to Azkaban.

question: Do you think one of them put my name in the goblet?
answer: I haven't a clue who put your name in that goblet Harry but whoever did it is no friend to you. People die in this tournament.

question: I'm not ready for this Sirius.
answer: You don't have a choice.

question: Someone's coming!
answer: Keep your friends close Harry.

question: Who you talking to?
answer: Who says I was talking to anyone.

question: I heard voices.
answer: Maybe you're imagining things, wouldn't be the first time.

question: Amazing. Amazing.
answer: Neville! You're doing it again!

question: Oh, right sorry.
answer: Magical water plants of the highland Lochs?

question: We've already been through enough people why don't you just go and do it yourself? Ughh. What do you want me to say again? Ronald would like me to tell you that Seamus told him that Dean was told by Parvati that Hagrid was looking for you.
answer: Is that right? Well.... what?

question: Uhhh... Dean was told by Parvati that... Please don't ask me say it again. Hagrid's looking for you.
answer: Well you can tell Ronald...

question: Did you bring your father's cloak like I asked you?
answer: Yeah I brought the cloak. Hagrid where are we going?

question: You'll see soon enough. Pay attention this is important.
answer: What's with the flower? Hagrid have you combed your hair?

question: As a matter of fact I have. You might like to try the same thing now and again.
answer: Hagrid?

question: Oh, the cloak. Put the cloak on. Bonsoir Olympe.
answer: Oh Hagrid. I thought you weren't coming, I thought perhaps... you had... forgotten me.

question: Couldn't forget you Olympe.
answer: What is it you want to show me? When we spoke earlier you sounded so exhilirated.

question: You'll be glad you came. Trust me.
answer: Ahh, c'est magnifique! Can we get closer?

question: Dragons? That's the first task? You're joking.
answer: Come on Harry. They're seriously misunderstood creatures. Although, I have to admit that horntail is a right nasty piece of work. Poor Ron nearly fainted just seeing him you know.

question: Ron was here?
answer: Oh sure. His brother Charlie helped bring him over from Romania. Didn't Ron tell you that?

question: No he didn't. He didn't tell me a thing. Thanks. Excuse me.. Can I have a word?
answer: Alright.

question: Dragons. That's the first task. They've got one for each of us.
answer: Are you serious? And Fleur and Krum, do they...?

question: Yes.
answer: Right. Hey listen, about the badges. I've asked them not to wear them.

question: Don't worry about it. You're a right foul git you know that?
answer: You think so?

question: I know so.
answer: Anything else?

question: Yeah. Stay away from me.
answer: Fine.

question: I'll teach you to cast when someone's back is turned.
answer: Professor Moody what are you doing?

question: Teaching.
answer: Is that a student?

question: Technically it's a ferret. Is that a threat! I could tell you stories about your father that would curl even your greasy hair boy! It doesn't end here!
answer: We never use transfigration as a punishment, surely Dumbledore told you that.

question: He might've mentioned it.
answer: Well you will do well to remember it.

question: come with me. That's a foal glass. Lets me keep an eye on my enemies. If I can see the whites of their eyes they're standing right behind me. Wouldn't even bother telling you what's in ther. You wouldn't believe it if I did. Now... what are you going to do about your dragon?
answer: Oh... um... You know I just thought I'd...

question: Sit. Listen to me Potter. Your pal Diggory, by your age he could take a whistle into a watch and have it sing you the time. Miss Delacour, she's as much a fairy princess as I am. As for Krum, his head may be filled with sawdust but Karkaroff's is NOT. They'll have a strategy, and you can bet that it'll play to Krum's strengths. Hmm? Come on Potter. What are your strengths?
answer: Um... I dunno.. I can fly. I mean I'm a fair flyer.

question: Better than fair the way I heard it.
answer: But I'm not allowed a broom.

question: Champions, in a circle around me. Miss Delacour over here, Mr Krum, and Potter over here. Right. Miss Delacour, if you will... The welsh green. Mr Krum... The chinese fireball. Oooooh. The swedish short-snout. Which leaves...
answer: The horntail...

question: What's that boy?
answer: Nothing.

question: I reckon you'd have to be barking mad to put your own name in the goblet of fire.
answer: Caught on have you. Took you long enough.

question: Wasn't just me who thought you'd done it. Everyone was saying it behind your back.
answer: Brilliant. That makes me feel loads better.

question: At least I warned you about the dragons.
answer: Hagrid warned me about the dragons.

question: Oh no no, I did. Don't you remember? I told Hermione to tell you that Seamus told me that Parvati told Dean that Hagrid was looking for you. Seamus never actually told me anything, so it was really me all along. I thought you'd be alright, you know, after you figured that out.
answer: Who could possibly figure that out? That's completely mental.

question: Now to dance is to let the body breathe, inside every girl a secret swan slumbers longing to burst forth and take flight.
answer: Something's about to burst out of Hilary but I don't think it's a swan.

question: Inside every boy a lordly lion prepared to prance. Mr Weasly, will you join me. Now, place your right hand on my waist.
answer: Where?

question: It might interest you to know that Neville's already got someone.
answer: Now I'm really depressed. Well Hermione, you're a girl.

question: Oh well spotted.
answer: Come on. It's one thing for a bloke to show up alone. For a girl it's just sad.

question: I won't be going alone because believe it or not someone's asked me. And I said yes.
answer: Bloody hell. Look. We've just got to grit our teeth and do it. Tonight when we get back to the common room, we'll both have partners. Agreed?

question: Agreed.
answer: Harry!

question: Cho!
answer: Watch yourself on the stairs, it's a bit icey at the top.

question: Ok thanks. Cho?
answer: Yes?

question: Um. I just wondered if maybe you wanted to go to the ball with me?
answer: Sorry? I didn't catch that.

question: Um. I was just wondering if maybe you wanted to go to the ball with me.
answer: Oh. Um. Harry I'm sorry but someone's already asked me. And well I've said I'll go with him.

question: Ok. Great. Fine. No problem. Good.
answer: Harry I really am sorry.

question: What happened to you?
answer: What?

question: What did she say?
answer: No of course. She said yes??

question: Don't be silly.
answer: There she was walking by. You know I like it when they walk. I couldn't help it, it just sort of slipped out.

question: What did you do then?
answer: What else? I ran for it. I'm not cut out for this Harry. I don't know what got into me.

question: Hey!
answer: Bloody hell. What are those??

question: My dress robes.
answer: Well they're alright. No lace, no dodgy little collar.

question: Well I expect yours are more traditional.
answer: Traditional?? They're ancient! I look like my great aunt Tessie. I smell like my great aunt Tessie. Murder me Harry.

question: Leave it alone.
answer: Poor kid, bet she's alone in her room crying her eyes out.

question: Who?
answer: Hermione of course. Come on Harry, why'd you think she wouldn't tell us who she's coming with?

question: Because we'd take the mickey out of her if she did.
answer: Because nobody asked her. I would have taken her myself if she weren't so bleeding proud.

question: Here you are Potter. Are you and Miss Patil ready?
answer: Ready professor?

question: To dance. It's traditional that the three champions or in this case four are the first to dance. Surely I told you that.
answer: No.

question: Hot isn't it? Viktor's gone to get drinks. Care to join us?
answer: No, we'd NOT care to join you and Viktor.

question: What's got your wand in a knot?
answer: He's a Durmstrang. You're fraternising with the enemy.

question: The enemy?? Who was it wanting his autograph? Besides, the whole point of the tournament is international magical cooperation, to make friends.
answer: Hrmph, I think he's got a bit more than friendship on his mind. No. He's using you.

question: How dare you! Besides I can take care of myself.
answer: Doubt it. He's way too old.

question: What? What? That's what you think?
answer: Yeah that is what I think.

question: You know the solution then don't you.
answer: Go on.

question: Next time there's a ball pluck up the courage and ask me before somebody else does, and not as a last resort.
answer: Well that's completely off the point. Harry...

question: Where have you been? Nevermind! Off to bed both of you.
answer: They get scary when they get older.

question: Harry you told me you'd figured the egg out weeks ago. The task is two days from now.
answer: Really? I had no idea. I suppose Viktor's already figured it out.

question: I wouldn't know, we didn't actually talk about the tournament. Actually we didn't really talk at all, Viktor's more of a physical being. I just mean he's not particularly... Mostly he watches me study. It's a bit annoying actually. You are trying to figure this egg out aren't you?
answer: What's that supposed to mean?

question: Hey Potter.
answer: Cedric.

question: How are you?
answer: Spectacular.

question: Look I realise I never really thanked you properly for tipping me off about those dragons.
answer: Forget about it. I'm sure you would have done the same for me.

question: Exactly. You know the prefects bathroom on the fifth floor? It's not a bad place for a bath. Just take your egg and mull things over in the hot water.
answer: I must be out of my mind.

question: I must be out of my mind.
answer: I'd try putting it in the water if I were you.

question: Myrtle!
answer: Long time no see. I was circling a blocked drain the other day and could swear I saw a bit of polyjuice potion. Not being a bad boy again are you Harry?

question: Polyjuice potion! Kicked the habit. Myrtle, did you say try putting it in the water?
answer: Well. That's what he did. The other boy, the handsome one. Cedric. Well go on, open it.

question: Myrtle, there aren't Merpeople in the black lake are there?
answer: Ahhh, very good. Took Cedric ages to riddle it out. Almost all the bubbles were gone...

question: Harry, tell me again.
answer: Come seek us where our voices sound.

question: The black lake, that's obvious.
answer: An hour long you'll have to look.

question: Again obvious, though I must admit potentially problematic
answer: Potentially problematic? When was the last time you held your breath under the water for an hour Hermione?

question: You know, if you're interested in plants you'd be better with Gorshok's Guide to Herbology. Do you know there's a wizard in Nepal whose growing gravity resistant trees?
answer: Neville. No offense, but I really don't care about plants. Now if there's a Tibetan turnip that will allow me to breathe underwater for an hour then great.

question: I don't know about a turnip but you can always use gilliweed.
answer: You're sure about this Neville.

question: Absolutely.
answer: For an hour.

question: Most likely.
answer: Most likely?

question: Well there is some debate among herbologists as to the effects of freshwater versus saltwater.
answer: You're telling me this now? You must be joking.

question: I just wanted to help.
answer: Well that makes you sight better than Ron and Hermione. Where are they anyway?

question: You seem a little tense Harry.
answer: Do I?

question: Harry!
answer: Hermione

question: Are you alright? You must be freezing! Personally I think you behaved admirably.
answer: I finished last Hermione.

question: A man has died here. And he won't be the last, you must take action.
answer: I will not. In times like these the wizard world looks to its leaders for strength Dumbledore.

question: Then for once show them some.
answer: The tri-wizard tournament will not be cancelled. I will not be seen as a coward.

question: But surely that is what's right, no matter what others think.
answer: What did you say? What did you say to me?

question: Igor Karkaroff, you have been brought from Azkaban at your own request to present evidence to this counsel. Should your testimony prove consequential. Counsel may be prepared to order your immediate release. Until such time you remain in the eyes of the ministry a convicted deatheater. Do you accept these terms?
answer: I do sir.

question: What do you wish to present?
answer: I have names sir. There was a Rosier, Evan Rosier.

question: Mr Rosier is dead.
answer: Dead?

question: I didn't know.
answer: If that is all the witness has to offer...

question: No! No! There was Rookwood, he was a spy.
answer: Augustus Rookwood? Of the department of ministries.

question: Ya ya, the same. He passed information to you know who from inside the ministry itself.
answer: Very well. Counsel will deliberate. In the meantime you will be returned to Azkaban.

question: It's a lie! Severus Snape remains faithful to the dark lord.
answer: Silence! Unless the witness possesses any name of genuine consequence this session is now concluded.

question: Oh no no no no no. I heard about one more.
answer: What's that?

question: The name...
answer: Yes?

question: I know for a fact this person took part in the capture, and by means of the cruciatus curse, torture of the aurer Frank Longbottom and...
answer: The name! Give me the wretched name!

question: Curiosity's not a sin Harry, but you should exercise caution. It's a pensieve, useful if like me you find your mind a wee bit stretched. It allows me to see what small things I've already seen. You see Harry I've searched and searched for something, some small detail. Something I might have overlooked, something that would explain why these terrible things have happened. Every time I get close to an answer it slips away, it's maddedning.
answer: Sir, Mr Crouch's son, what happened to him?

question: He was sent to Azkaban. Destroyed Barty to do it. But he had no choice, the evidence was overwhelming. Why do you ask?
answer: It's just that I had a dream about him. It was in the summer, before school. In the dream I was in a house and Voldemort was there only he wasn't quite human, and Wormtail was there too and Mr Crouch's son.

question: Have there been other dreams like this?
answer: Yes. Always the same one. Sir... these dreams, what I see, you don't think it's actually happening do you?

question: Potter! What's your hurry? Congratulations, your performance in the black lake was inspiring. Gilliweed, am I correct?
answer: Yes sir.

question: Ingenious. A rather rare herb gilliweed, not something found in your every day garden. Nor is this, know what it is?
answer: Bubble juice sir?

question: Veritaserum. Three drops of this and you-know-who himself will spill his darkest secrets. The use of this on a student is regrettably forbidden, however should you ever steal from my personal stores again, my hand might just slip over your morning pumpkin juice.
answer: I haven't stolen anything.

question: Fleur? Fleur!
answer: Get down!

question: No stop! He's bewitched Cedric.
answer: Get off me!

question: He's bewitched!
answer: Harry! Harry! You know for a moment there I thought you were gonna let it get me.

question: For a moment so did I.
answer: Some game huh?

question: Some game.
answer: Go. Take it, you saved me!

question: Together, on three. One, two, three!
answer: You ok?

question: Yeah, you?
answer: Where are we?

question: I've been here before.
answer: It's a portkey. Harry the cup is a portkey.

question: I've been here before in a dream. Cedric, we have to get back to the cup? Now!
answer: What are you talking about? What is it?

question: Get back to the cup!
answer: Who are you? What do you want?

question: Do it, now!
answer: Bones of the father, unwillingly given. Flesh of the servent willingly sacrificed. Blood of the enemy forcibly taken. The dark lord shall rise again.

question: My wand Wormtail. Hold out your arm.
answer: Master. Thank you master.

question: The other arm Wormtail. Welcome my friends. Thirty years it's been, and yet you stand before me as though it were only yesterday. I confess myself disappointed, not one of you tried to find me. Not even you, Lucius. There were signs my friend, and more than whispers.
answer: I returned.

question: Out of fear, not loyalty. Still you have proved yourself useful these past few months Wormtail.
answer: Thank you master, thank you.

question: Oh, such a handsome boy.
answer: Don't touch him.

question: Harry! I'd almost forgotten you were here. Standing on the bones of my father. I'd introduce you but word has it you're almost as famous as me these days. The boy who lived. How lies have fed your legend Harry. Shall I reveal what really happened that night thirteen years ago? Shall I divulge how I truly lost my powers? It was love. You see when dear sweet Lily Potter gave her life for her only son she provided the ultimate protection. I could not touch you. It was old magic, something I should have forseen. But no matter, no matter. Things have changed, I can touch you now! Astonishing what a few drops of your blood will do eh Harry? Pick up your wand Potter. I said pick it up, get up. Get up! You've been taught how to duel I presume yes? First we bow to each other. Come on now Harry the niceties must be observed, Dumbledore would not want you to forget your manners now would he? I said bow! That's better. And now... Atta boy Harry, your parents would be proud. Especially your filthy mongrel mother. I'm going to kill you Harry Potter, I'm going to destroy you. After tonight no one will ever again question my powers. After tonight if they speak of you they'll speak only of how you begged for death, and I being a merciful lord obliged. Get up. Don't you turn your back on me Harry Potter I want you to look at me when I kill you, I want to see the lights leave your eyes.
answer: Have it your way.

question: Are you alright Potter? Does it hurt?
answer: Not so much now.

question: I'd better take a look at it.
answer: The cup was a portkey. Someone had bewitched it.

question: What was it like? What was he like?
answer: Who?

question: The dark lord. What was it like to stand in his presence?
answer: I dunno. It was like I'd fallen into one of my dreams. One of my nightmares.

question: Were there others? In the graveyard, were there others?
answer: Um. I don't think I said anything about a graveyard Professor.

question: Marvellous creatures dragons aren't they? Do you think that miserable oaf would have led you into the woods if I hadn't suggested it? Do you think Cedric Diggory would have told you to hold the egg under the water if I hadn't have told him first myself? Do you think Neville Longbottom the witless wonder could have provided you with gilliweed if I hadn't have given him the book that led you straight to it? Huh??
answer: It was you from the beginning. You put my name in the goblet of fire. You bewitched Krum. But...

question: You won because I made it so Potter. You ended up in that graveyard tonight because it was meant to be so. And now the deed is done. The blood that runs through these veins runs within the dark lord. Imagine how he will reward me when he learns that I have once and for all silenced the great Harry Potter.
answer: Severus... Do you know who I am?

question: Albus Dumbledore.
answer: Are you Alastor Moody? Are ya?

question: No.
answer: Is he in this room? Is he in this room? Harry get away from there! Are you alright Alastor?

question: Now we know who's been stealing it from your store Severus. We'll get you up in a minute. Barty Crouch Junior.
answer: I'll show you mine if you show me yours.

question: Your arm Harry.
answer: You know what this means don't you? He's back. Lord Voldemort has returned.

question: Send an owl to Azkaban, think they'll find they're missing a prisoner.
answer: I'll be welcomed back like a hero.

question: No.
answer: No I don't think so.

question: Everything's going to change now isn't it?
answer: Yes.
